channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MNN: A Universal and Efficient Inference Engine
item.description: Deploying deep learning models on mobile devices draws more and more attention recently.

item.title: Deep Industrial Image Anomaly Detection: A Survey
item.description: In this paper, we provide a comprehensive review of deep learning-based image anomaly detection techniques, from the perspectives of neural network architectures, levels of supervision, loss functions, metrics and datasets.

item.title: RAGAS: Automated Evaluation of Retrieval Augmented Generation
item.description: We introduce RAGAs (Retrieval Augmented Generation Assessment), a framework for reference-free evaluation of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines.

item.title: pySLAM: An Open-Source, Modular, and Extensible Framework for SLAM
item.description: pySLAM is an open-source Python framework for Visual SLAM, supporting monocular, stereo, and RGB-D cameras.

item.title: Large Language Models for Cyber Security: A Systematic Literature Review
item.description: Overall, our survey provides a comprehensive overview of the current state-of-the-art in LLM4Security and identifies several promising directions for future research.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Mamba-based Language Models
item.description: On an additional 23 long-context tasks, the hybrid model continues to closely match or exceed the Transformer on average.

item.title: Aligning Multimodal LLM with Human Preference: A Survey
item.description: In this paper, we aim to provide a comprehensive and systematic review of alignment algorithms for MLLMs.

item.title: TinyLlama: An Open-Source Small Language Model
item.description: We present TinyLlama, a compact 1. 1B language model pretrained on around 1 trillion tokens for approximately 3 epochs.

item.title: Towards Deeper, Lighter and Interpretable Cross Network for CTR Prediction
item.description: It is crucial to effectively model feature interactions to improve the prediction performance of CTR models.

item.title: Optuna: A Next-generation Hyperparameter Optimization Framework
item.description: We will present the design-techniques that became necessary in the development of the software that meets the above criteria, and demonstrate the power of our new design through experimental results and real world applications.

item.title: Improving Multi-modal Recommender Systems by Denoising and Aligning Multi-modal Content and User Feedback
item.description: Multi-modal recommender systems (MRSs) are pivotal in diverse online web platforms and have garnered considerable attention in recent years.

item.title: On the Use and Misuse of Absorbing States in Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this work, we first demonstrate that sample complexity increases with the quantity of absorbing states in a toy supervised learning task for a fully connected network, while attention is more robust to variable size input.

item.title: pyribs: A Bare-Bones Python Library for Quality Diversity Optimization
item.description: Recent years have seen a rise in the popularity of quality diversity (QD) optimization, a branch of optimization that seeks to find a collection of diverse, high-performing solutions to a given problem.

item.title: Hyperbolic Dataset Distillation
item.description: To address the computational and storage challenges posed by large-scale datasets in deep learning, dataset distillation has been proposed to synthesize a compact dataset that replaces the original while maintaining comparable model performance.

item.title: PyTorch: An Imperative Style, High-Performance Deep Learning Library
item.description: Deep learning frameworks have often focused on either usability or speed, but not both.

item.title: Efficient Prediction of SO(3)-Equivariant Hamiltonian Matrices via SO(2) Local Frames
item.description: This is achieved by introducing a set of new efficient and powerful SO(2)-equivariant operations and performing all off-diagonal feature updates and message passing within SO(2) local frames, thereby eliminating the need of SO(3) tensor products.

item.title: Exploring Progress in Multivariate Time Series Forecasting: Comprehensive Benchmarking and Heterogeneity Analysis
item.description: Multivariate Time Series (MTS) analysis is crucial to understanding and managing complex systems, such as traffic and energy systems, and a variety of approaches to MTS forecasting have been proposed recently.

item.title: A Framework For Contrastive Self-Supervised Learning And Designing A New Approach
item.description: Contrastive self-supervised learning (CSL) is an approach to learn useful representations by solving a pretext task that selects and compares anchor, negative and positive (APN) features from an unlabeled dataset.

item.title: Desiderata for next generation of ML model serving
item.description: Inference is a significant part of ML software infrastructure.

item.title: PyPop7: A Pure-Python Library for Population-Based Black-Box Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we present an open-source pure-Python library called PyPop7 for black-box optimization (BBO).
